A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: It’s a good film. It’s well structured with great action scenes and wonderful CGI. The slapstick comedy was a nice touch but only warranted a smirk or a small chuckle - nothing hilarious. However\, I couldn’t help feel but let down by the direction Disney wants to take the Star Wars franchise after this film. Snoke seemed to be a great villain that could have had arc throughout the franchise\, but I’m guessing he was unimportant; and apparently Mark Hamill is pulling a Harrison Ford in this film. What’s key to point out is his character was underplayed and the way they sent him off was honorable and emotional but not as heartfelt - they certainly could have done better given his precedence. Overall\, it’s worth it for the action but be weary of the flattened answers to the questions you had from the Force Awakens. Plus\, the dullness and cheesiness of certain parts of the movie might just want you to walk out cringing.
